content.question:
<math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6, plus, 6 O 2, react to produce, 6 C O 2, plus, 6 H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>â†’</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
The reaction between <math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the balanced equation above. In an experiment, <math alttext="0.30 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> was produced from the reaction of <math alttext="0.05 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.05</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> with excess <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The reaction was repeated at the same temperature and in the same container, but this time <math alttext="0.60 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.60</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> was produced. Which of the following must be true?

choices.label: The initial amount of <math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the container must have been <math alttext="0.10 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Exactly <math alttext="0.30 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> must have reacted because <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms were conserved.

Exactly <math alttext="0.40 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of must have reacted because the temperature and container volume are the same.

More than <math alttext="0.60 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.60</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> must have reacted because it was present in excess.

content.answer: The initial amount of <math alttext="C 6 H 12 O 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the container must have been <math alttext="0.10 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
